sentences.english: He burst into the room red-faced and out of breath .
sentences.chinese: 他衝進房間，臉色通紅，氣喘吁吁。

sentences.english: Until the lane Mo jeans aloud of ask for forgiveness, he just release her.
sentences.chinese: 直到弄墨氣喘吁吁的討饒，他才放開她。

sentences.english: He laid himself down under the thwarts and waited, panting.
sentences.chinese: 躺在坐板下面，氣喘吁吁地等着開船。

sentences.english: Dongsheng buries his head in her bosom, and opens his mouth breathlessly.
sentences.chinese: 冬生的頭往又福嫂懷中拱，嘴巴張開，氣喘吁吁。

sentences.english: We heard her gasping out her children's names.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽到她氣喘吁吁地說出她孩子們的名字。

sentences.english: He panted excitedly giving us the news as he had just heard it.
sentences.chinese: 他氣喘吁吁，興奮地將他剛剛聽到的消息轉告給我們。

sentences.english: I've always been able to hold my breath for a long time without having to do the hyperventilating.
sentences.chinese: 我總能閉氣很長一段時間而不會氣喘吁吁。
這個人汗流浹背，氣喘吁吁地停了下來並點了點頭。

sentences.english: The old man panted forth the hope on his deathbed will.
sentences.chinese: 老人臨終時氣喘吁吁地說出了他的臨終遺囑。

sentences.english: The old man coughed badly and wheezed out a few words.
sentences.chinese: 那個老人咳嗽得厲害，氣喘吁吁地說了幾句話。

sentences.english: She coughed dryly, wheezing with each breath.
sentences.chinese: 她乾咳着，每次呼吸都氣喘吁吁。

sentences.english: By the time you get back home, huffing and puffing, you probably will have discovered that your cravings have totally subsided.
sentences.chinese: 當你氣喘吁吁地回到家裏，你可能發現食慾全無。

sentences.english: The young man was running and wheezing out a greeting.
sentences.chinese: 那個年輕人邊跑步邊氣喘吁吁地打招呼。

sentences.english: Thus , the assistant panted out the reason. The king once was bite by a panda on the palm
sentences.chinese: 因而助手氣喘吁吁地說出了原因。

sentences.english: She puffed as she climbed the stairs.
He rushed into the room, red-faced and out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 他臉色通紅，氣喘吁吁地衝進房間。

definition: variant of 喘吁吁[chuan3 xu1 xu1]
to breathe heavily like an ox (idiom)/to huff and puff
out of breath (idiom)/to gasp for air
pinyin: shang4 qi4 bu4 jie1 xia4 qi4
